overview: The purpose of this subject is to further develop the ideas explored in the subject New Venture Creation: Initiation and conduct validation to launch a viable entrepreneurial venture. Students are expected to work according to their entrepreneurial interests and to extend learning from Semester 1. The project is best done in teams of 3-4 students but can also be done individually or in pairs with permission of the instructor.

During the subject, students will learn how to test and validate their business idea, develop a minimum viable product (MVP) and iterate using feedback from customers and other stakeholders. In addition, they will learn to develop a market entry strategy that takes into account competitors and collaborators. Students also learn pitching skills to communicate their ideas, with the goal of persuading investors and acquiring resources for growth. In this process, students learn skills to establish viability of their entrepreneurial concepts and pivot their initial models.
ilo: Test, validate and reorientate strategic directions
Develop and test a market entry strategy
Demonstrate skills in presenting to relevant business audiences
generic_skills: Thinking critically and being able to apply relevant knowledge

Prerequisites.content: Admission into one of the following:
CodeNameTeaching periodCredit PointsMGMT90230New Venture Creation: InitiationSemester 1 (On Campus - Parkville)12.5

assessment.brief: Group validation plan (groups of 3-4). 350 words equivalent per student
assessment.hurdle: A proper validation plan is required in order to carry out validation tests. Students cannot proceed in the subject without successfully completing this task

assessment.brief: Group feedback presentation (12 mins) and written project update (400 words per student) (groups of 3-4)
Group pitch presentation (15 mins) and accompanying poster (400 words) (groups of 3-4)
